title: Peter walked 30 metres towards South, took a left turn and walked 50 metres, again he took a left and walked 30 metres. How far is he and in which direction from the starting point? - Quora

response.answer_text: The things will be clearer if we draw a diagram of the situation . Let Peter starts walking from pointh A and walks 30m Southwards and reaches pointB A | | | B Then according to the problem he turuns left and walks 50m to point C . The situation is depicted diagrammatically like this A | | | | | | B — — — — — C He again turns leftwards , walks 30m and reaches point D A | __ __ __ __ __ D | | B — — — — — C Now the final position reached by Peter is D , he is clearly at a distance of 50m from starting point A which is clearly eastwards ie towards left of his starting position A . ( I am finding difficulty in drawing 3 lines upwards to depict 30m , the gap between C and D. ) | B — — — — — C

Assuming a top view for how Peter is walking (North upwards, south downwards, etc.), then when Peter is walking towards South, his left would be facing East, he faces East then walks 50 meters, his left would be facing North, he faces North and walks 30 meters, that makes him 50 meters to the East of where he first started.
